  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster(String name, Long maxHP, ArrayList<AnchorPoint> anchorPoints, HashSet<DamageType> damageTypes, SkinType skintype) throws InvalidNameException, InvalidDamageTypesException, InvalidSkinTypeException
      A constructor for a monster with a given name, maxHP, anchorpoint, damageTypes, SkinType
      Parameters:
      name - name of the monster
      maxHP - maxHP of the monster
      anchorPoints - anchorpoints of the monster
      damageTypes - damagetypes of the monster
      skintype - skintype of a monster
      Preconditions:
      DamageTypes must be Valid 
      areValidDamageTypes(damageTypes)
      SkinType must be valid 
      isValidSkinType(skintype)
      Postconditions:
      Capacity of monster is set 
      this.setCapacity()
      DamageTypes of monster are set 
      this.setDamageTypes(damageTypes)
      SkinType of monster is set 
      this.setSkinType(skintype)
      Effects:
      if SkinType not valid set it to SkinType.TOUGH 
      if !isValidSkinType(skintype)
then this.setSkinType(SkinType.TOUGH)
      if damageTypes are not Valid theyre set to DamageType.TAIL 
      if !areValidDamageTypes(damageTypes)
then this.setDamageTypes( new HashSet<DamageType>(List.of(DamageType.TAIL)))
      every anchorpoint has a chance to get an Item 
      createLoot()

    • Monster

      public Monster(String name) throws InvalidNameException, InvalidDamageTypesException, InvalidSkinTypeException
      A constructor for a monster with a given name
      Parameters:
      name - name of the monster
      Effects:
      monster is created using a more advanced monster constructor 
      this(name, 997L, new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(
          AnchorPoint.BELT,
          AnchorPoint.BACK,
          AnchorPoint.BODY,
          AnchorPoint.LEFTHAND,
          AnchorPoint.RIGHTHAND
  )), new HashSet<>(List.of(DamageType.CLAWS)), SkinType.THICK )

    • getAdjustedRoll

      public int getAdjustedRoll(int roll)
      getter for the adjusted roll of a monster, If the roll is less than the current HP, the roll is returned unchanged. Otherwise, the method returns the HP value, effectively capping the roll at the current HP.
      Overrides:
      getAdjustedRoll in class Entity
      Parameters:
      roll - roll we need to adjust
      Returns:
      the adjusted roll, which is the smaller of roll or the object's current HP 
      result = (roll < this.getHP()) ? roll : (int) this.getHP()

    • isValidName

      public boolean isValidName(String name)
      Checks whether the given name is a valid name
      Overrides:
      isValidName in class Entity
      Parameters:
      name - The name to be checked
      Returns:
      True if the name is valid, not empty and follows the nameRegex, false otherwise 
      result == (name != null) && name.matches(nameRegex)

    • areValidDamageTypes

      @Raw public boolean areValidDamageTypes(HashSet<DamageType> damageTypes)
      checks if a monster has valid DamageTypes
      Specified by:
      areValidDamageTypes in class Entity
      Parameters:
      damageTypes - the damagetypes that need to be checked
      Returns:
      true if Damagetypes are all different from Normal, false otherwise 
      for each damagetype in damagetypes :
  if damagetype != NORMAL
      then result == true
result == false

    • isValidSkinType

      @Raw public boolean isValidSkinType(SkinType skinType)
      checks if skintype of a monster is valid
      Specified by:
      isValidSkinType in class Entity
      Parameters:
      skinType - SkinType we need to check
      Returns:
      true if different from Normal, false otherwise 
      result == (skinType != SkinType.NORMAL)
